outputs.output_descr: The project has two main components: 1) build national institutional capacity to carry put ODA programmes/projects in partner countries; 20 raise awareness at national level on Romanian ODA.

Since EU accession in 2007, Romania has been expanding its international development cooperation. Legal and policy frameworks for Official Development Assistance (ODA) have been prepared and stipulate coordinating and monitoring role for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA). The project at hand is intended to support Romania's efforts to become a lead donor of development assistance in the priority countries and regions of Romania's international development cooperation policy. It will focus on supporting the MFA to further develop its capacity to implement ODA projects and programs by providing a flexible administrative and implementation mechanism for ODA delivery.

After joining the European Union in January 2007, Romania has changed its status from development assistance (DA) recipient to DA provider. In supporting the development and packaging of knowledge, expertise and capacities that are necessary to undertake the new role, the current project aims to strengthen the capacity of the Romanian NGOs for implementing ODA projects in priority countries and regions. To this end, the UNDP will support the Romanian Platform of Development Nongovernmental Organizations (FOND) in organizing three benchmark events that will encourage the development of civil society networks between the countries in the region, fostering the development of joint projects and creating opportunities for transferring the Romanian expertise abroad.

Strengthened capacity of the Romanian Non-Governmental Organizations for implementing ODA projects and programs, active and efficient involvement of the Romanian NGOs in organizing two major events which bring together all the important stakeholders in development cooperation field: civil society organizations, governmental actors, experts from European and international donors, partner countries, mass-media, academia and the private sector

The UNDP will support the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to develop its capacity to implement ODA-funded projects. The programme is intended to support Romania's efforts to become a lead donor of development assistance in the priority countries and regions of Romania's international development cooperation policy. The programme implementation is also part of the larger objective to better define the niche areas in which Romanian ODA can be most effectively channelled and to set up the institutional framework of the Romanian Training Centre for Post-conflict Reconstruction that will ensure the sustainability of efforts in this area.

After joining the European Union in January 2007, Romania has changed its status from development assistance (DA) recipient to DA provider. In support of creating the knowledge, expertise and capacities that are necessary to undertake the new role, the current project aims to strengthen the capacity of the Romanian Non-Governmental Organizations for implementing ODA projects and programs and to reach an active and efficient involvement of the Romanian NGOs in organizing three major events which bring together all the important stakeholders in development cooperation field: civil society organizations, governmental actors, experts from European and international donors, partner countries, mass-media and the academia. The three events will encourage networking among the various actors in the area, fostering the development of joint projects and creating opportunities for transferring the Romanian expertise abroad.

The UNDP will support the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to develop its capacity to implement ODA-funded projects. The programme is intended to support Romania's efforts to become a lead donor of development assistance in the priority countries and regions of Romania's international development cooperation policy.

Strengthened capacity of the Romanian Non-Governmental Organizations for implementing ODA projects and programs, active and efficient involvement of the Romanian NGOs in organizing two major events which bring together all the important stakeholders in development cooperation field: civil society organizations, governmental actors, experts from European and international donors, partner countries, mass-media, academia and the private sector

The UNDP will support the MFA in the implementation of a training programme in the field of reconstruction and development. The programme is intended to support post-conflict reconstruction and recovery efforts in the priority regions and countries of Romania's international development cooperation policy. The programme implementation is part of the larger objective to set up the institutional framework of the Romanian Training Centre for Post-conflict Reconstruction that will ensure the sustainability of efforts in this area. The 5-day training programme targets practitioners of post-conflict recovery as well as civilian and military actors in recovery and reconstruction.

The UNDP will support the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to develop its capacity to implement ODA-funded projects. The programme is intended to support Romania's efforts to become a lead donor of development assistance in the priority countries and regions of Romania's international development cooperation policy. The programme implementation is also part of the larger objective to better define the niche areas in which Romanian ODA can be most effectively channelled and to set up the institutional framework of the Romanian Training Centre for Post-conflict Reconstruction that will ensure the sustainability of efforts in this area.

After joining the European Union in January 2007, Romania has changed its status from development assistance (DA) recipient to DA provider. In support of creating the knowledge, expertise and capacities that are necessary to undertake the new role, the current project aims to strengthen the capacity of the Romanian Non-Governmental Organizations for implementing ODA projects and programs and to reach an active and efficient involvement of the Romanian NGOs in organizing three major events which bring together all the important stakeholders in development cooperation field: civil society organizations, governmental actors, experts from European and international donors, partner countries, mass-media and the academia. The three events will encourage networking among the various actors in the area, fostering the development of joint projects and creating opportunities for transferring the Romanian expertise abroad.

The UNDP will support the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to develop its capacity to implement ODA-funded projects. The programme is intended to support Romania's efforts to become a lead donor of development assistance in the priority countries and regions of Romania's international development cooperation policy.

The current project aims to strengthen the capacity of the Romanian Non-Governmental Organizations to implement ODA projects and programs in ODA priority countries and regions. To this end, the UNDP will support the Centre for European Policies (CRPE) in organizing the Romania  Ukraine Civic Forum that will encourage the development of civil society organizations networks between the two countries, fostering the development of joint projects and creating opportunities for transferring the Romanian expertise abroad.

project_descr: Strengthening the National Institutional and Educational Capacity to Carry Out Official Development Assistance (ODA) Programmes and Projects (SNIECODA)
project_title: Strengthen Capacity to Carry out ODA Programmes
